policy_name: Indoor Practice Severe Weather Policy – FRD (Advanced)

rules.action: Cancel practice immediately and notify all members
Cancel practice immediately; assess venue safety for hail or wind damage
Cancel practice due to potential road hazards
Cancel practice if freezing rain or ice accumulation on roads reaches unsafe levels
Cancel or relocate if travel routes to venue are flooded or impassable
Cancel practice if snowfall ≥ 2" within 24 hours due to poor road conditions
Cancel practice if ice on roads or parking lot ≥ 0.25"
Cancel or relocate if sustained heavy rain (≥ 0.5 in/hr) causes flooding risk around venue
Cancel practice if sustained wind ≥ 40 mph or gusts ≥ 55 mph threaten building safety
Cancel practice if hail of any size is forecast or reported near venue
Cancel practice if visibility ≤ 0.25 miles due to heavy fog or blizzard conditions
Issue travel advisory and consider canceling if ambient temperature ≤ 0 °F with wind chill
Advise hydration and consider shortening practice if venue is not air-conditioned
Advise hydration, schedule extra breaks, or cancel if heat index ≥ 100 °F
Recommend rescheduling if AQI ≥ 100 (Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups) and venue ventilation is poor
Cancel or move practice if AQI ≥ 150 (Unhealthy) and venue ventilation is inadequate
